posts.title: Georgia mother says she is being forced to keep brain-dead pregnant daughter alive under abortion ban law
top_comments:
>  "It should have been left up to the family,” Newkirk said, telling the station that doctors informed the family they are legally not allowed to consider any other options.
“I’m not saying that we would have chose to terminate her pregnancy, but what I’m saying is, we should have had a choice,” she said.
A spokesperson for Emory Healthcare said it “uses consensus from clinical experts, medical literature, and legal guidance to support our providers as they make individualized treatment recommendations in compliance with Georgia’s abortion laws and all other applicable laws.”
“Our top priorities continue to be the safety and wellbeing of the patients we serve,” the spokesperson said.
Newkirk said the family is also having to deal with the financial responsibility of keeping Smith on life support. 

Disregarding the family's wishes and then dumping all the financial costs which will be astronomical on them. Truly heinous.

That photo is this woman pregnant with her FIRST child. 

She was only 8/9 weeks pregnant when she became braindead. That wasn't a viable fetus. They're keeping her body on machines for months and months for the slight chance this baby doesn't die immediately after artificial birth.

And of course she first went to the hospital where she was basically ignored, and now they are throwing everything they can at her to keep her body as an incubator for a baby that, even if it somehow survives, will be thrown to the wolves by the state.

This is a literal plot point from the TV show The Handmaid's Tale, where a brain-dead woman is kept hooked up in a hospital until they can cut the baby out of her. Nice to know that our current society is mirroring an incredibly depressing dystopian hellscape of a show.

It's even worse than what a lot of posters here are reacting to: there's a good chance that if it weren't for the risks to the pregnancy, the doctors could have intervened with the clots that rendered her braindead, because they mentioned that they had found it in time and were about to try to relieve pressure. She's braindead because of that. They aren't just keeping her on life support to incubate the fetus, they KILLED HER in order to incubate the fetus.

Not only has she been brain dead and on life support to maintain her body as an incubator for more than 90 days, she was only nine weeks pregnant so she has another couple of months to go.

Meanwhile, her toddler son doesn’t actually know she’s (brain) dead because he sees his mommy looking asleep so he hasn’t gotten a chance to grieve yet. Her family hasn’t gotten a chance to grieve. Her mother is going to live with this trauma for the rest of her life. 

And they’re going to get the bill for all of this when they’re finally allowed to let her pass.

The cruelty is the point, but it’s amazing how often they keep coming up with new ways of being even crueler.

How DARE they use that photo while reporting she was 9 weeks pregnant. They’re deliberately misleading the public into thinking this was a full term viable pregnancy rather than what it really is which is the same age most pregnancies fail. This is not only ghoulish on the people responsible but on NBC for this deliberately manipulative reporting. Shame on NBC and I hope you all will spread the word where you can. This has major implications.
This is some genuine Handmaids Tale shit.
Okay, then the state of Georgia should foot the bill for every bit of the medical costs.

Ghoulish behavior by the state. On top of the lack of control over her own daughter's end of life and the general indignity of the situation, the mother has to deal with the costs of keeping her on life support.

posts.title: Georgia woman missing in California's Sierra Nevada for weeks found alive in snow-covered cabin
top_comments:
> Gutierrez said he leaves a cabin unlocked for situations like this, allowing for an increased chance of survival.

The true hero of this story.
The first thing she did was go to hug her rescuer, the first thing her dad did when she knew she was safe was to hug the nearest person to him. 🥲
I remember this woman's brother posting in some of the local hiking subs asking for help searching etc. Astonishing she was found, I'm so glad.
Good news feels rare these days. So happy she was found alive
The BLM handles the upkeep on alot of little cabins on public land for just this reason

Driving the Alcan and took a wrong turn and ended up going a few hours out of our way which sucked. Pull over to a small cabin with a map board and confirm we were going the wrong way but man that cabin was soooo cool. It was a big out cabin hours from any civilization that had two bunk beds, basic canned food, firewood with a wood stove and other basics and an outhouse. There was a wonderful guest book and read through stories of people getting stuck in storms and finding the cabin and using it to survive the night or until the weather passed and they could get back on the road. Totally worth the detour, also saw my first and only white colored black bear.

This is wonderful news! So happy that she was fine and going home to her family. 

Also, how wonderful sounding is that family? Tiffany is found and the first thing she does is hug her rescuer. Her mother is told she’s been found and all she wants is a hug from a stranger. 

Sound like lovely people which makes me extra glad Tiffany was found alive and well.

The cabin owner SAVED HER LIFE!

He admitted he only leaves one of his cabins unlocked and stocked with emergency supplies SPECIFICALLY for blizzard shelter in case of emergency like this.

Fucking saint.
She was lost for THREE weeks?! Wow that’s miraculous
Everyone please, buy an SOS device.

posts.title: RFK Jr orders mifepristone review as anti-abortion groups push for ban
top_comments: Didn't this man just say nobody should take health advice from him yesterday? This country has fully turned into a farce.
We need to spread a rumor that mifepristone treats measles. He will defend it with gusto.
“LeAvE iT tO tHe StAtEs”
Review has already been done. It does exactly what it says it does and is perfectly safe

For my miscarriage- I took mifepristone so that I would be in pain for a weekend instead of an indefinite time over the course of 4 weeks.  There was no fetal development.  But if my body couldn’t pass the tissue on its own, then I could have been in excruciating pain for a month or more and on the line to lose my job, or worse possibly developed sepsis.

1 in 4 known pregnancies end in miscarriage.  It’s even higher for first time pregnancy.  This is not an outlier situation.  You know people who have had miscarriages and gotten treatment for it.  All this medication ban would do is make women suffer. 

These people are extreme lunatics.   Death cult material who think women are property and status symbols, not people.

Ladies and people who care about ladies: if you can acquire this, do so. The day is coming when it will be more difficult than just about anything to get, if not impossible. Miscarriages are incredibly dangerous if all of the tissue is not expelled, and many hospitals refuse to offer any kind of aid due to the new laws across much of the South until a woman is nearly dead.

  
And even then, if your baby is viable and you are not, they'll just keep you on machines until you deliver. Adriana Smith is suffering this fate in Georgia as we speak after a hospital refused care for a brain bleed when she was 9 weeks. She is now 21 weeks, and is being kept alive against her family's wishes due to the heartbeat law.
The party of forced birth and indifference toward living children strikes again.

The US health secretary, Robert F Kennedy Jr, said on Wednesday that he had directed the FDA to review the regulations around the abortion pill mifepristone.

The review, he said, was necessary due to “new data” – data that emerged from a flawed analysis that top US anti-abortion groups are now using to pressure the Trump administration to reimpose restrictions on the abortion pill, if not pull it from the market entirely.

...**The analysis, which has not been peer-reviewed or published in a medical journal**, came after the Food and Drug Administration commissioner said he was open to reviewing new safety data on the pills, which are used in nearly two-thirds of abortions nationwide.

The conservative organizations are rallying behind a paper published on 28 April by a rightwing thinktank, the Ethics and Public Policy Center, which claims there are higher complication rates from taking mifepristone than previously known.

The paper has attracted scrutiny for appearing to dramatically overstate what it characterizes as “serious adverse effects” associated with the pill, according to medical experts. For example, it counts ectopic pregnancies – when an embryo implants somewhere other than the uterine lining – as a serious complication.

Mifepristone does not cause an ectopic pregnancy and taking it will not harm someone with an ectopic. It also claims that needing an in-clinic procedure to complete the abortion is a complication, when patients are counseled in advance about the pills’ failure rate of about 3 to 4%.

**The data, the authors say, means the FDA should reinstate earlier restrictions on mifepristone, including a ban on telemedicine and limiting use to the first seven weeks of pregnancy – but they do not intend to stop there.**

The authors note that restoring the limits could lead to better monitoring that could help “determine whether this drug should remain on the market”, statements that echo proposals found in Project 2025, the 900-page playbook published by the Heritage Foundation and for which the EPPC was an advisory board member.

**Project 2025 calls to end telemedicine prescriptions of abortion pills as an “interim step” to revoking mifepristone’s approval altogether.**

More than 100 scientific studies have found the medications cited in the paper are safe and effective for ending a pregnancy.

What happens to women who are miscarrying/have miscarried but the tissue hasn't passed when they ban this and ban D&Cs?

A shit ton of women are going to die from sepsis (aka infections that are easily preventable with the healthcare options they want to ban).

Not a single fucking thing about these bans is "pro-life."

Weird that anyone doesn't believe that they are really just trying to legislate that women are basically children that need men to make their decisions, so if you think about it that's why it is OK for them to marry children.

Literally, that is a pretty clear overlap on the venn diagram of legislating agenda they have been on target for.

  
\----

A quick edit so I don't come accross as hyperbolic or simply lobbing petty insults:  

I realized I should probably [bring reciepts](https://www.rollingstone.com/politics/politics-features/republican-lawmakers-child-marriage-abortion-1235018777/). 

There are a [*lot*](https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/politics-news/end-child-marriage-u-s-you-might-be-surprised-who-n1050471) of reciepts. 

They've tried "[defending child marriage is actually pretty pro-choice of me](https://www.newsweek.com/republican-defends-child-marriage-im-pro-choice-1898619)" and "[if you ban child marriage, you're letting the gays win](https://www.tba.org/?pg=Articles&blAction=showEntry&blogEntry=30366)"  along the way . . . landing on their most successful attack yet . . .  

"[a woman is like a child](https://www.yahoo.com/news/woman-child-maga-quickly-turns-105907677.html)" . . . and if woman == child, then it stands to reason that child == women . . . 

Obviously, you wouldn't say women shouldn't be allowed to have an adult sexual relationship within the confines of a legally binding marriage contract that they can leave anytime they want to have enough money and a good lawyer. Which is also why child labor is so important, so that they could obviously have left the marriage if they didn't want to be there.

It also makes sense of other agenda pushes that would otherwise feel pointless and unrelated, like the absolute insane amounts of hate against women they've pushed on the youth in recent years.

top_comments:
this will be an interesting one for the courts.


federal law [prevents colleges from withholding diplomas for disciplinary issues](https://registrar.lmu.edu/ferpa-rightsandprivacyact/#:~:text=FERPA%20requires%20that%20education%20records,on%20release%20of%20directory%20information.) to prevent this exact situation, a graduate isnt liked by someone on the schools board, so they choose to withhold their diploma. withholding one against federal law can lead to your school losing accreditation, which is a death sentence for a college because ALL diplomas issued by them become worthless in every career field.


they can only withhold it if you owe them money, or they believe you committed fraud to get your degree. the fraud claim requires an academic court ruling to withhold diplomas or honors

The use of the term anti-governmental to describe the USAID speech a month ago was the sign of how fascist NYU already was. Anti-governmental is completely valid speech in the US. Just say Anti-regime you fucking cowards. I'm sure a lawyer will volunteer to inform NYU of their inability to withold the degree and this will be quietly resolved.

> Following Rozos’s speech, NYU released a statement saying that it “strongly denounces the choice by a student at the Gallatin School’s graduation today … to misuse his role as student speaker to express his personal and one-sided political views”.

Translation: “As an educational institution, we strongly denounce the choice by a student to rightfully exercise their first amendment rights. As such, we are illegally withholding said student’s rightful diploma, due to the fact that we have an incredibly strong desire to suck the toad-like micropenis which belongs to the orange rapist/traitor/felon.”

>Rozos went on to say: “The genocide currently occurring is supported politically and militarily by the United States, is paid for by our tax dollars and has been livestreamed to our phones for the past 18 months. And that I do not wish to speak only to my own politics today, but to speak for all people of conscience, and all people who feel the moral injury of this atrocity.”

>

Think about it.

Why is it so important to Democrats and Republicans that Americans or  foreigners in America support a Far Right Wing fascist foreign Government like Israel?  Free speech exists in America to support or condemn any country we want, to protect unpopular speech.   This is another person who was viewed as an "Anti-semite" for criticizing the Israel Government or Zionist that operate that government.

That is an interesting decision NYU just made.

Why would anyone PAY to go to a university that is so publicly against human rights?

Does NYU realize that without students paying them to go to their university, they are fucking fucked? Do they think we're dumb?

**Edit**: For anyone currently deciding on where to go to college in a few months, just remember that giving money to immoral, amoral, faceless, and suppressive institutions will perpetuate this human rights problem. Vote with your wallet.

posts.title: Penn State blames looming campus closures on ‘declining’ Pennsylvania
top_comments:
Grew up and went to one of those satellite campuses. It was a great school and opportunity for the rural area I lived in. I’m grateful to have had it.

They’re right though about the demographics. I left PA because there was so little there as an adult. It never fully recovered (in my area) after coal dried up and then 08 hit. My county was old even when I was young. 

It’ll always be home, but I didn’t have it in me to stay.
Have they tried increasing Pennsylvania?

Almost no one here read the article or understands what it really means. Penn State is closing branch campuses, which cater almost entirely to local populations. No one from out of state dreams of going to Penn State Shenango on the border of Ohio, which is over an hour from any major population center. No one is moving to Sharon PA either. The population peaked in the 50's and is half of what it was then. It is #197 of cities by population in PA. Sure Penn States tuition is bonkers, blah blah. But declining rural populations and branch campuses in nowheresville are the reason for this.

Meanwhile at Penn State‘s main campus, they are aiming to increase enrollment by thousands of students, but the local borough passed a zoning ordinance effectively banning most off-campus apartments from the core of downtown.

To nobody’s surprise, housing is becoming crushingly unaffordable there. I’m sure the landlords on the Planning Commission are more than happy about that!

We’re going to see much more of this “feast or famine” in higher education over the next couple decades, and it’s going to get ugly.
..and 20 years later, almost all the children had been left behind.

I read the article and frankly I suggest many others to as well as it feels like the posts in here are either bad jokes are personal quips....while the article is providing quotes such as: 

> The Keystone State is among five states expected to account for three-fourths of the national decline in high school graduates, with a 17% reduction projected through 2043, the report says.

and 

> The report cites lower birth rates following the 2008 recession and reduced K-12 enrollment trends, exacerbated by the COVID-19 pandemic’s “lingering effects on earlier grade retention” for what it calls Pennsylvania’s looming “demographic cliff.”

and 

> “Pennsylvania is facing widespread population declines, with rural areas experiencing the most pronounced reductions. Forty-one of Pennsylvania’s 67 counties are facing significant population declines: rural counties are projected to lose 5.8% of their total population by 2050, while urban counties are projected to grow slightly (+4.1%),” the report states.

Yea, this isn't a joking matter. It's a state university who is seeing a demographic that they don't think will latent their college alongside a trend they think is going to rock PA and shrinking itself now so it doesn't embarrass itself later. I don't know the state of PA so I don't know how this affects those closing campuses but I do feel that it's better to close than to occupy at limited capacity just to state that you're still open. I bet this also means that unless something magical happens tuition will also unfortunately increase as more students will funnel into their other campuses which will potentially stress resources 

Awful all around but better to do now than later
Why doesn’t Pennsylvania simply eat the other states?

Many public universities just shoot themselves on the foot by building elaborate stuff that the students don't need at all for their education and having ever increasing "administrative costs". This leads to tuition hikes and then they wonder why less people want to go to college.
The children yearn for the mines.
I’m fucking begging every state to increase taxes on large corporations

posts.title: US Supreme Court scrutinizes Trump bid to restrict birthright citizenship
top_comments: So if we want to be very clear, the SCOTUS are not debating the birthright citizenship issue outright. They are debating/ruling on whether the lower courts had the authority to put an injunction on Trump's end to birthright citizenship. Obviously this will have an immediate direct effect on birthright citizenship if the courts overturn it, but then the executive order itself would have to be brought before the SCOTUS.

This case is not really about the merits of the administration’s interpretation of the 14th amendment and birthright citizenship.

Rather, the questions are focused more on whether courts has the authority to enjoin executive action, nationwide, through something called a “universal injunction.”

Surprisingly, several of the conservatives justices seemed skeptical of the administration’s position on these universal injunctions, as they pressed the solicitor general to explain how affected individuals would even have an effective remedy for constitutional-rights violations if a court has no authority to impose a universal injunction on facially unconstitutional executive action.
As it’s been the law of the land up to now, I’m hoping the Court will fall back on the historical application of the law and not restrict it now.  Crossing fingers!

More insidious than that.

The trump admin is trying to get the SC to rule that lower courts cannot grant injunction relief except in their own court and affecting only those specific plaintiffs.    This would slow down and increase the cost of taking the government to court for unlawful actions.   They want the court to change due process on injunctive relief.  And by change, I mean , take away.
When you stop adhering to some of the Constitution its not long before none of is adhered to at all.
Service Guarantees Citizenship! Would you like to know more?
So when trump says that birthright citizenship was intended for slaves, can we counter that and ask about removing the 2nd amendment because that was intended for muskets???

It's an international crime to make someone stateless. We'll put that on your tab, you orange prick. I can't wait for the world to impose sanctions against the US and switch from the dollar to the euro as an international reserve currency.

Up until this ruling I believed I was a US citizen by virtue of being born here and having a birth certificate to attest that fact.  Now I have no clear way of determining whether in fact I am a citizen, what rules apply?  How are those rules changed and how does it affect whose citizenship?  It’s all crazy.
If you really want to be picky then everyone except native Americans should leave the land in this case.

That baby is adorable

>…arrested Harsono in March at his job at a Marshall hospital, days after his student visa was revoked without his knowledge.

They revoked his visa without his knowledge! Setting him up for his arrest. Disgusting.
Until the fascism stops, I’m not paying taxes. I refuse to fund this unconstitutional authoritarian clown show. We need a national tax strike.

posts.title: Florida becomes 2nd state to ban fluoride from public drinking water
top_comments: As much as I just assume that Republicans hate all humanity and wants to hurt them, I'm wondering who got bribed by whom for this bizarre mental breakdown.

I moved to rural America and they all really believe fluoride is some mind controlling substance or something. I can tell them that I spent most of my life with it and I’m fine but it goes in one ear and out the same ear. Also, there’s no shortage of fucked up teeth out here. Coincidence? Maybe.
Judging by my nephew’s teeth I’m surprised Florida ever had Fluoride in its drinking water.

Nice thing is we’ll have places to compare dental health differences between.  We’ll have states with fluoride and ones without and in 20 years we can check tooth healths between thing, as well as all the crazy things RFK says fluoride causes.  The science will be pretty easy with such large cohorts.

"You don't gotta force it and take away people's choices. But the whole crux of the issue is you should be able to make decisions on the basis of informed consent," said the motherfucker who funneled $10 Million in taxpayer money through his wife's charity and back to himself to fight legalization of weed.

These clowns sure do love talking about choice. Funny how it's always for fringe conspiracy theories and not for whether or not people are forced to learn about the bible in schools, access to safe abortion, lifestyle choices, or many other things.

Fluoride? In our water? Not here! We don't want no stinking pacifying neurotoxins!
Giving the "Florida man" persona a grin
New "No Teeth" DLC for GTA6 announced

I had a moron of a neighbor back in 2015 and he was into the conspiracies, like the moon landing fake, flat earth, chem trails, and this fluoride bad bullshit.  

This idiot spent as he claims $1k on a water filter he found on "the internet" that removes the fluoride. This same idiot would then instead of brushing his teeth would use coconut oil to clean them. 

Then to top it off everyday he would put diatomaceous earth in water and drink it.  He inhaled so much of this silica that he ended up with a chronic cough and I think he possibly damaged his lungs enough that he basically now has asthma or COPD. 

Oh and this same idiot thinks wooden soled shoes protect him from demons.

I would like to give you an update on this guy but he was evicted in 2016 and I've no clue what became of him. It's a safe bet he's had teeth issues.
No one will notice in that state.

posts.title: Georgia woman missing in California's Sierra Nevada for weeks found alive in snow-covered cabin
top_comments:
> Gutierrez said he leaves a cabin unlocked for situations like this, allowing for an increased chance of survival.

The true hero of this story.
The first thing she did was go to hug her rescuer, the first thing her dad did when she knew she was safe was to hug the nearest person to him. 🥲
I remember this woman's brother posting in some of the local hiking subs asking for help searching etc. Astonishing she was found, I'm so glad.
Good news feels rare these days. So happy she was found alive
The BLM handles the upkeep on alot of little cabins on public land for just this reason

Driving the Alcan and took a wrong turn and ended up going a few hours out of our way which sucked. Pull over to a small cabin with a map board and confirm we were going the wrong way but man that cabin was soooo cool. It was a big out cabin hours from any civilization that had two bunk beds, basic canned food, firewood with a wood stove and other basics and an outhouse. There was a wonderful guest book and read through stories of people getting stuck in storms and finding the cabin and using it to survive the night or until the weather passed and they could get back on the road. Totally worth the detour, also saw my first and only white colored black bear.

This is wonderful news! So happy that she was fine and going home to her family. 

Also, how wonderful sounding is that family? Tiffany is found and the first thing she does is hug her rescuer. Her mother is told she’s been found and all she wants is a hug from a stranger. 

Sound like lovely people which makes me extra glad Tiffany was found alive and well.

The cabin owner SAVED HER LIFE!

He admitted he only leaves one of his cabins unlocked and stocked with emergency supplies SPECIFICALLY for blizzard shelter in case of emergency like this.

Fucking saint.
She was lost for THREE weeks?! Wow that’s miraculous
Everyone please, buy an SOS device.

posts.title: NYU withholds diploma of student who condemned Israel in graduation speech
top_comments:
this will be an interesting one for the courts.


federal law [prevents colleges from withholding diplomas for disciplinary issues](https://registrar.lmu.edu/ferpa-rightsandprivacyact/#:~:text=FERPA%20requires%20that%20education%20records,on%20release%20of%20directory%20information.) to prevent this exact situation, a graduate isnt liked by someone on the schools board, so they choose to withhold their diploma. withholding one against federal law can lead to your school losing accreditation, which is a death sentence for a college because ALL diplomas issued by them become worthless in every career field.


they can only withhold it if you owe them money, or they believe you committed fraud to get your degree. the fraud claim requires an academic court ruling to withhold diplomas or honors

The use of the term anti-governmental to describe the USAID speech a month ago was the sign of how fascist NYU already was. Anti-governmental is completely valid speech in the US. Just say Anti-regime you fucking cowards. I'm sure a lawyer will volunteer to inform NYU of their inability to withold the degree and this will be quietly resolved.

> Following Rozos’s speech, NYU released a statement saying that it “strongly denounces the choice by a student at the Gallatin School’s graduation today … to misuse his role as student speaker to express his personal and one-sided political views”.

Translation: “As an educational institution, we strongly denounce the choice by a student to rightfully exercise their first amendment rights. As such, we are illegally withholding said student’s rightful diploma, due to the fact that we have an incredibly strong desire to suck the toad-like micropenis which belongs to the orange rapist/traitor/felon.”

>Rozos went on to say: “The genocide currently occurring is supported politically and militarily by the United States, is paid for by our tax dollars and has been livestreamed to our phones for the past 18 months. And that I do not wish to speak only to my own politics today, but to speak for all people of conscience, and all people who feel the moral injury of this atrocity.”

>

Think about it.

Why is it so important to Democrats and Republicans that Americans or  foreigners in America support a Far Right Wing fascist foreign Government like Israel?  Free speech exists in America to support or condemn any country we want, to protect unpopular speech.   This is another person who was viewed as an "Anti-semite" for criticizing the Israel Government or Zionist that operate that government.

That is an interesting decision NYU just made.

Why would anyone PAY to go to a university that is so publicly against human rights?

Does NYU realize that without students paying them to go to their university, they are fucking fucked? Do they think we're dumb?

**Edit**: For anyone currently deciding on where to go to college in a few months, just remember that giving money to immoral, amoral, faceless, and suppressive institutions will perpetuate this human rights problem. Vote with your wallet.
NYU classifies “zionist” as discriminatory?  That is nuts.
Honorary degree from ______ when?
Extortion of free speech.

A New York institution supportive of Israel?!  
Well, now we've seen everything!
Bill Maher, your thoughts?

so wild, so human too. Keep going!
Godspeed … We eagerly await your return V’ger
They don’t make em like they used to.

posts.title: Autopsies misclassified in-custody deaths that were actually homicides, Maryland officials say
top_comments:
> Medical examiners under Dr. David Fowler were “especially unlikely to classify a death as a homicide if the decedent was Black, or if they died after being restrained by police,” Attorney General Anthony Brown said Thursday during a news conference.

I recall during the BLM protests people telling me to my fucking face "All lives matters, not just black people!"

The problem is we keep proving - in America, no they don't.  When a cop can kill you and "Well, they were black - it doesn't matter, you won't have the consequences" - it proves **once again** that black lives do **not** matter, and will not matter until we force the people who keep abusing them to own up to it and suffer the consequences for it.
Imagine all the atrocities done before body cameras (and other cameras such as CCTV and smartphones)
misclassified sounds like there was no intent!
Looks like the local taxpayers would be paying a lot to cover a few dozens lawsuit against the police over wrongful death.

People talk about Baltimore being "dangerous" as a dog whistle for having a robust black community that is distrusting of the local police force, while that same maligned community **KNOWS** stuff like this has been happening for decades.

posts.title: Victorville foster children kept journals of strangulation, other abuse, DA says
top_comments: I assumed it was going to be [this](https://youtu.be/lXF_squiTr4?si=OgWDR33BOtuK0dnm) family, because the same scenario occurred.  Older foster kid ran away and got help.  But, nope, wrong state entirely…. Sad this is so common.

*“There is some indication that when there were visits by social workers, the kids were told to go on script,” Anderson said.*

A "family" foster home can be as oppressive as a private or public foster home.  All three make use of fear in employing more and more control over their children.
Reading articles like this make me grateful for my own upbringing and stable homelife I am so sorry that kids who never did anything wrong to anyone had to go through this.
These foster parents should go to jail for life. This is just heartbreaking.

As a foster kid I ate from the dollar store in my separate add-on apartment, foster parents ate from Albertson's downstairs and collected their check. Saw them once a week when I washed their dishes and cleaned their house.  Good ol' Karen and Gordy.
